classmeta.shortdesc: Widget for selecting a file or a directory.

desc.simpara: GtkFileSelection is used to retrieve file or directory names selected by the user. It creates a dialog window containing a directory list and a file list corresponding to the specified or current working directory and its contents. The filesystem can be navigated using either the directory tree or the drop-down history menu. Alternatively, the TAB key can be used either to auto-complete file-names typed into the entry field or to navigate either list, and the spacebar can be used to select items.

The default filename or directory can be set using set_filename() and the selected filename retrieved using get_filename(). If no filename has been selected then the current directory will be returned.
Use complete() to display files that match a given pattern. This can be used for example, to show only *.txt files, or only files beginning with gtk*.
Simple file operations - create directory, delete file and rename file - are available from buttons in the dialog which are shown by default. These can be hidden using hide_fileop_buttons().
Sets the default path for the directory and/or filename.
Returns a string representing the current value in the file selector. If no directory or file has been selected then the current path is returned.

method.shortdesc: Matches a given pattern to a valid filename.

desc.simpara: Will attempt to match the given pattern to a valid filename in the current directory. If a full match is made, the matched filename will appear in both the file list and the text entry field of the file selection dialog. If only partial matches can be found, the file list will contain the resulting filenames and the text entry field will contain the closest matched string (not the full filename). Note that only a single wildcard field is effective here.

Shows the file operation buttons Create Dir, Delete File and Rename File. This is their default state, so that show_fileop_buttons() would only be used following a call to hide_fileop_buttons(). The rest of the widgets in the dialog will be automatically resized to accommodate the status of the file operation buttons. These buttons do not need any programming in order to carry out their respective functions, as these are already hard-coded into GTK+.

Hides the file operation buttons Create Dir, Delete File and Rename File which by default appear at the top left-hand corner of a GtkFileSelection. hide_fileop_buttons() is useful where a custom file selector based on the GtkFileSelection widget is required.

property.shortdesc: Accessible GtkCList within the GtkFileSelection widget's structure.

desc.simpara: GtkCList widget embedded in the GtkFileSelection dialog that displays the subdirectories available in the current directory.
desc.para:
In order to access dir_list it is necessary to create a handle for it, e.g.
$dir_list_handle = $fs->dir_list;

property.shortdesc: Accessible GtkCList within the GtkFileSelection widget's structure.

desc.simpara: GtkCList widget embedded in the GtkFileSelection dialog that displays the list of files available in the current directory.
desc.para:
In order to access file_list it is necessary to create a handle for it, e.g.
$file_list_handle = $fs->file_list;

property.shortdesc: Accessible GtkEntry within the GtkFileSelection widget's structure.

desc.simpara: GtkEntry widget at the bottom of the GtkFileSelection dialog that displays the current file selection.
desc.para:
In order to access selection_entry it is necessary to create a handle for it, e.g.
$selection_entry_handle = $fs->selection_entry;

property.shortdesc: Accessible GtkLabel within the GtkFileSelection widget's structure.

desc.simpara: The selection_text property is a GtkLabel that by default contains the string Selection: plus the current directory selected.
desc.para:
In order to access selection_text it is necessary to create a handle for it, e.g.
$selection_text_handle = $fs->selection_text;

property.shortdesc: Accessible GtkVBox within the GtkFileSelection widget's structure.

desc.simpara: A GtkVBox placed below the two GtkCLists and above the selection_entry widget. Additional Gtk widgets can be packed into this container and will appear below the Create Dir, Delete File and Rename File buttons that are standard with the GtkFileSelection (if shown).
desc.para:
In order to access main_vbox it is necessary to create a handle for it, e.g.
$main_vbox_handle = $fs->main_vbox;

property.shortdesc: Accessible GtkButton within the GtkFileSelection widget's structure.

desc.simpara: GtkButton widget at the bottom of the GtkFileSelection dialog. It is the programmer's responsibility to listen for signals from this button and take the appropriate action.
desc.para:
In order to access ok_button it is necessary to create a handle for it, e.g.
$ok_button_handle = $fs->ok_button;

property.shortdesc: Accessible GtkButton within the GtkFileSelection widget's structure.

desc.simpara: GtkButton widget at the bottom of the GtkFileSelection dialog. As with the ok_button, it is the programmer's responsibility to listen for signals from this button and take the appropriate action.
desc.para:
In order to access cancel_button it is necessary to create a handle for it, e.g.
$cancel_button_handle = $fs->cancel_button;

property.shortdesc: Accessible GtkHBox within the GtkFileSelection widget's structure.

desc.simpara: A GtkHBox placed between the main_vbox mentioned above and the two GtkCLists for the directory and file list.
desc.para:
In order to access action_area it is necessary to create a handle for it, e.g.
$action_area_handle = $fs->action_area;
